Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra and Devon Conway shared an unbeaten 273-run third-wicket stand.
Conway and Ravindra overtook the 168-run stand between Chris Harris and Lee Germon from 1996.
New Zealand managed to cross the target in 36.2 overs to win by nine wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand's stand-in skipper Tom Latham decided to field in Ahmedabad.
The match was a rematch between the two finalists from the 2019 Cricket World Cup.
Ben Stokes and Kane Williamson were absent for their respective teams.
Post-Match Reflections: Devon Conway expressed pride in the team's performance after the win.
Tom Latham, New Zealand's skipper, called it right at the toss and decided to field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Will Young was dismissed for a first-ball duck early in the innings.
Jos Buttler hit a six off the second ball of the game, but fell to Ravindra for 43.
England's scoring rate was stifled after losing Moeen to Phillips' off-spin.
